title: This has been ideal for Eden Hazard and Chelsea - Pat Nevin
text: Premier League Championship Scottish Premiership This has been ideal for Eden Hazard and Chelsea - Pat Nevin EDEN HAZARD will have really benefited from his rest over the international break, according to Chelsea legend Pat Nevin. PUBLISHED: 22:01, Tue, Mar 28, 2017 | UPDATED: 22:29, Tue, Mar 28, 2017 The winger was ruled out of featuring for Belgium in their World Cup qualifier against Greece on Saturday and tonight’s friendly with Russia. Eden Hazard has been sidelined since Chelsea’s 1-0 FA Cup triumph over Manchester United two weeks ago with a calf strain . The 26-year-old sat out the Blues’ last game as they beat Stoke 2-1 before the international break. However, he is said to be winning the race to be fit to face Crystal Palace in the Premier League at Stamford Bridge on Saturday (3pm). GETTY Eden Hazard last featured for Chelsea on March 13 The recovery time probably did him some good in the end Pat Nevin Hazard’s future has been much-publicised of late with Real Madrid pursuing a world-record summer move . And Nevin feels the time away from football will have helped re-energise Chelsea’s key man ahead of the season run-in. “Eden Hazard might be winning his battle for fitness for the game against Palace, so the recovery time probably did him some good in the end,” Nevin wrote in his column for Chelsea’s website . “The Belgians would have liked him to be available for their 1-1 draw against Greece, but that would have been pushing it I reckon. Chelsea's injury crisis ahead of Crystal Palace clash Mon, March 27, 2017 Chelsea manager Antonio Conte is facing a potential injury crisis ahead of their Blues' Premier League clash with Crystal Palace on Saturday (3pm)
